title: How to Make Meatballs Quickly

steps.headline: Select your favorite meatball recipe and follow the directions on how to make up the meatball mixture.
Place the meatball mixture onto a clean, flat surface.
steps.description: A cutting board is particularly good to use as you will be using a knife to cut the meatballs.

steps.headline: Flatten the meatball mixture out evenly in a square.
Cut the meat into squares using a sharp knife.
Choose whether to leave the meatballs in square shapes or roll them into round shapes.
steps.description: The square "meatballs" are not as pretty but are quicker to make.

steps.headline: Place the meatballs onto a greased baking sheet.
steps.description: Bake at 400°F or for approximately 30 minutes or until the meatballs test done.

steps.headline: Add 1 tablespoon butter to a large skillet.
Saute the chopped onion in the melted butter until the onion is tender.
Add the breadcrumbs and water to a large mixing bowl.
steps.description: Mix to combine. Let mixture stand 1 to 2 minutes.

steps.headline: Add the ground beef, ground pork, sauteed onion, salt, allspice, white pepper and sugar to a mixing bowl.
Turn the mixer to high speed and beat the mixture until light and fluffy.
Shape meatballs following the suggested method.
steps.description: You can also shape the meatballs by dipping two spoons in ice cold water before shaping them into small meatballs. They should look like large marbles.

steps.headline: Add the melted butter to the skillet and heat.
Brown the meatballs in the hot butter.
steps.description: Shake the pan often so all sides of the meatballs are evenly browned.

steps.headline: Drain browned meatballs on paper towels.
Add the beef consomme to the skillet.
steps.description: Bring to a boil while stirring vigorously to remove the browned bits of meat in the skillet.

steps.headline: Cook the beef consomme until thickened, about 10 to 15 minutes.
Add the meatballs to a pretty serving dish.
Pour the thickened beef consomme over the meatballs.
Add the torn bread to a mixing bowl.
Pour milk over the torn bread and let stand 5 minutes.
Add the egg, beef, cheese, basil, oregano, salt and pepper to the meat mixture.
Mix to combine.
Shape into meatballs using the suggested quick method.
Bake the meatballs for approximately 30 minutes  at 400°F or 204°C, or until meatballs test done.
Pour your favorite spaghetti sauce into a saucepan.
Drop meatballs into the saucepan.
Simmer meatball mixture for approximately 20 minutes.
Serve over hot cooked spaghetti.

text: Standard Meatballs Select your favorite meatball recipe and follow the directions on how to make up the meatball mixture.  Place the meatball mixture onto a clean, flat surface. A cutting board is particularly good to use as you will be using a knife to cut the meatballs. Flatten the meatball mixture out evenly in a square.  Cut the meat into squares using a sharp knife.  Choose whether to leave the meatballs in square shapes or roll them into round shapes. The square "meatballs" are not as pretty but are quicker to make. Place the meatballs onto a greased baking sheet. Bake at 400°F or for approximately 30 minutes or until the meatballs test done. Smorgasbord Meatballs Add 1 tablespoon butter to a large skillet. Melt the butter. Saute the chopped onion in the melted butter until the onion is tender. This should take 1 to 2 minutes. Add the breadcrumbs and water to a large mixing bowl. Mix to combine. Let mixture stand 1 to 2 minutes. Add the ground beef, ground pork, sauteed onion, salt, allspice, white pepper and sugar to a mixing bowl.  Turn the mixer to high speed and beat the mixture until light and fluffy. This should take about 10 minutes. Shape meatballs following the suggested method. You can also shape the meatballs by dipping two spoons in ice cold water before shaping them into small meatballs. They should look like large marbles. Add the melted butter to the skillet and heat.  Brown the meatballs in the hot butter. Shake the pan often so all sides of the meatballs are evenly browned. Drain browned meatballs on paper towels.  Add the beef consomme to the skillet. Bring to a boil while stirring vigorously to remove the browned bits of meat in the skillet. Cook the beef consomme until thickened, about 10 to 15 minutes.  Add the meatballs to a pretty serving dish.  Pour the thickened beef consomme over the meatballs.  Italian Style Meatballs Add the torn bread to a mixing bowl.  Pour milk over the torn bread and let stand 5 minutes.  Add the egg, beef, cheese, basil, oregano, salt and pepper to the meat mixture.  Mix to combine.  Shape into meatballs using the suggested quick method.  Bake the meatballs for approximately 30 minutes  at 400°F or 204°C, or until meatballs test done.  Pour your favorite spaghetti sauce into a saucepan.  Drop meatballs into the saucepan.  Simmer meatball mixture for approximately 20 minutes.  Serve over hot cooked spaghetti.
sentences: Standard Meatballs Select your favorite meatball recipe and follow the directions on how to make up the meatball mixture.
Place the meatball mixture onto a clean, flat surface.
A cutting board is particularly good to use as you will be using a knife to cut the meatballs.
Flatten the meatball mixture out evenly in a square.
Cut the meat into squares using a sharp knife.
Choose whether to leave the meatballs in square shapes or roll them into round shapes.
The square "meatballs" are not as pretty but are quicker to make.
Place the meatballs onto a greased baking sheet.
Bake at 400°F or for approximately 30 minutes or until the meatballs test done.
Smorgasbord Meatballs Add 1 tablespoon butter to a large skillet.
Melt the butter.
Saute the chopped onion in the melted butter until the onion is tender.
This should take 1 to 2 minutes.
Add the breadcrumbs and water to a large mixing bowl.
Mix to combine.
Let mixture stand 1 to 2 minutes.
Add the ground beef, ground pork, sauteed onion, salt, allspice, white pepper and sugar to a mixing bowl.
Turn the mixer to high speed and beat the mixture until light and fluffy.
This should take about 10 minutes.
Shape meatballs following the suggested method.
You can also shape the meatballs by dipping two spoons in ice cold water before shaping them into small meatballs.
They should look like large marbles.
Add the melted butter to the skillet and heat.
Brown the meatballs in the hot butter.
Shake the pan often so all sides of the meatballs are evenly browned.
Drain browned meatballs on paper towels.
Add the beef consomme to the skillet.
Bring to a boil while stirring vigorously to remove the browned bits of meat in the skillet.
Cook the beef consomme until thickened, about 10 to 15 minutes.
Add the meatballs to a pretty serving dish.
Pour the thickened beef consomme over the meatballs.
Italian Style Meatballs Add the torn bread to a mixing bowl.
Pour milk over the torn bread and let stand 5 minutes.
Add the egg, beef, cheese, basil, oregano, salt and pepper to the meat mixture.
Mix to combine.
Shape into meatballs using the suggested quick method.
Bake the meatballs for approximately 30 minutes  at 400°F or 204°C, or until meatballs test done.
Pour your favorite spaghetti sauce into a saucepan.
Drop meatballs into the saucepan.
Simmer meatball mixture for approximately 20 minutes.
Serve over hot cooked spaghetti.
tyn_section: Aluminum Foil (if you choose to line the baking pan for easy clean-up)
